intro: Chrysocephalum serpens, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. It is often used in dried floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms and striking color.
